The waitress agreed that they serve way too much food-she said they often suggest to management just serving one piece of meat, But for some reason they don't, except for lunch. I guess they prefer to make their contribution to America's obesity problem. 
 
We arrived 6PM  Friday night and had a short, 10 minute wait. They only take reservations for 6 or more.

Don't get Texa'z' food in Phoenix.  It wasn't very good.  The meat was a very small portion (not exactly following the saying of everything is bigger in Texas).  The side dishes were not very good, but the desert was pretty good.

Did I mess up and not get the chicken fried steak which this restaurant is known for?  My health had the best of me when considering it was a fried dish, so I avoided it.  But then I opted for a very lean slab of beef which isn't exactly the healthiest either.

I do have to commend them in making Shiner Bock their house beer.  Luckily it wasn't the Lone Star.  The Shiner Bock Black was pretty good.

i was recommended to this place by a friend of mine who said he hadn't been here in awhile but thought it was great last time he was there. i really wish i didn't listen to him.

when my girlfriend i entered the building the first sign of this place sucking was probably the empty dining room, but it was around 8:30 so that i can understand. what i cannot understand and what was such a disappointment, was the food. 

I ordered the rib-eye which on the menu said it was "Jim's special", which wasn't so special at all but ill get into that in a minute, my girlfriend ordered the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and  the brisket sand which as her entree. now, for 6 bucks i expect more than 4 tiny shrimp, but it was good so that still gets my OK.

 what doesn't get my OK was the steak. my rib-eye, which was like 18 bucks, a reasonable price for a reasonable sized steak, was probably smaller than a hamburger patty and was well done when i ordered it medium. the mashed potatoes as my side i ordered double of which i wish i didn't, because it was more like double gravy, single mashed potatoes. the gravy itself tasted like it was pure lard, and i was unable to even eat it because it was just so heavy. I'm a bigger guy, i like fattening food, but that was just gross to me. my girlfriends food wasn't that much better. 

when the bill came around, it was 48 bucks, which is what i left with no tip because the service was equally terrible, she was rude and acted like she wanted us gone. i have NEVER not left a tip. 

i know this place has a great reputation, and that's what got me in there, but when i left i was honestly impressed by how bad that was. i almost want to call my friend that suggested this place to me and tell him he owes me 50 bucks. 

not worth it, never coming back here again.

We went here last Saturday.  Good decor, pretty good service, food needs some work.

We were greeted when we arrived and told how long the wait was.  Then, after the expected wait were shown to our table.  So far so good.

We ordered our dinners, two of which included Salad.  The greens for the salad looked they came out of a bag and definitely were not fresh.  Kind of that slimy one week old feeling ... We both had the house dressing.  Didn't like it.

My wife had the chicken, I had the Lin Su (a steak with two shrimp on top, and our son had the BBQ.  My son liked the BBQ.  My wife and I didn't care for ours.  Perhaps we were so turned off by the salad that it colored our perception of the meal.  I'm not sure.  We might try it again.  Hopefully the salad is an anomaly.

Legendary chicken fried steak and awesome mashed potatoes and gravy. Whatever distance you may be from this little piece of heaven, get in the car and go. I would recommend training for the moment for at least a couple weeks because your food capacity limits will be tested. Best I've had in a VERY long time. Could not recommend more highly.
Food was ok but not horrible, but not that great as everyone makes it out to be!. It's pretty much your average restaurant so I don't understand the hype to much.. and over pricedddddddd!!!!!

BEST PRIME RIB..  but the side dishes lack.  You wont leave hungry however.  The biscuits with honey are the bomb!!!    Other great items are the Ribeye steak and of course the chicken fried steak.......

A great grill with incredible food at very reasonable prices. The Pablo battered shrimp are great! The smoked prime rib is incredible. Would recommend anyone passing through Phoenix be sure and stop here!
The Chicken Fried Steak is to die for - best ever.  And, chopped green olives in the house salad - so simple, so good.  Come back for the smoked prime rib.

My co-worker took me to eat here let's just say I ordered the Chicken Fried Chicken and inhaled it....damn it was good!! Listen you're  are not coming here to order the salad and watch your calories so get over it and throw down on some good food! Plus it's easy on the pockets and you will for sure need a nap afterwards. Look forward to coming back to try more stuff off the menu!

I stopped by here with a friend after a meeting in the area.  He is a native and never eaten here before.  We ordered their best dish.  The chicken fried steak.  It was really really good.  I have had CFS all over the country and this place serves some of the best.  It came with white gravy, mashed potatoes and corn.  The CFS was cooked to perfection and crispy.  You looking for a good CFS try this place.  They are cooked fresh.

Still not feeling well after eating at this restaurant. I ordered the ribeye steak. It arrived swimming in grease, having clearly been pan fried, too long. The flavor of the meat tasted like meat that sat in the fridge too long. My husband, typically a hearty eater, didn't even eat a quarter of his meal. It's really too bad, because the staff here seem nice. It isn't a place we would choose again.

YUM!  A definite thumbs up and will be back !  :) Very friendly and attentive staff! We will definitely be back. Chicken fried steak huge cook well, smashed skins on taters, yum.  A definite recommend.

I've been going to TexAZ Grill for the best part of 20 years. I really used to enjoy it - had not been there for many years and just went back last week. Most everyone at the table wasn't that happy with the food - the ribs that someone had were particularly lackluster. I ordered one of the early bird specials, a small NY with a cheese enchilada and thought it was pretty good - but at $9.50 my expectations were not real high. The service was just OK _ I had to get up to ask someone for bread plates, as we didn't have any. The biscuits (which used to be awesome) were kind of cold and hard. I'd go back one more time for sure, because my favorite is their Chicken Fried Chicken, but as I didn't order that, I would have to try it one more time before I crossed this place off of my list...it really did used to be great food with great service, but this last time, it really was just decent food with acceptable service.

My Dad and my brothers are big steak eaters. Me? Not so much. So when we came here a few weeks back I hoped the reviews lived up to their hype. Not at all. First, it was a Saturday night at 7 p.m and the place was nearly empty.

My New York strip steak was bland. The fried potatoes are huge, plain and flavorless - no seasoning whatsoever. Everyone else thought their prime rib and steaks were boring and average. The martinis? Microscopic. Hanny's style. I couldn't decide which were smaller. Hanny's or Texaz?

I think the three stars I'm giving is really generous, but the atmosphere here rocks (you find something new on the wall every time) and our server had an awesome attitude and handled our 7 person party professionally. I may or may not be back.

Some good traditional home cooking. The Chicken Fried Steak is a must try. The Prime Rib smoked over Pecan wood, OMG that was a treat. The gravy here is amazing and the Pecan Pie is from heaven. No matter how full I get with dinner I still order the pie and it manages to disappear. Thank God I don't live around here cuz it would not be good for my health.

I wanted to grab something to eat on my way home from work . I stopped by TEXAZ grill . I was slobs so I sat at the bar . I had the rib eye. It was cooked to perfection . The taste was amazing . Very tender and juicy. My mashed potatoes and gravy were yummy !  So creamy and the gravy was thick and had lots of flavor . Tammy at the car is always so nice and attentive .   Can't wait to go back

Great food, sweet staff, great times! 

Came here on a Monday night, tired and in search of a good meal. Delivered.

Ordered their speciality, chicken fried steak and it met plus exceeded the hype. Huge portion and extremely flavorful! Add a dose of southern hospitality and you have the perfect weeknight meal.

Highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.

We went there last night and I'm thinking other reviews must be from their regulars. It was nothing like other reviews described. Our waitress seemed to have an instant dislike to us. When I asked for the honey mustard dressing she said "There's no honey in it, it's our house vinaigrette." I ordered it and it was totally wilted. I like to always let my husband sample my food and when she saw me give it to him she said "You don't like it!". My steak was bland and had to be sent back because it was underdone. Our friend is a vegetarian and asked if they could make her a grilled cheese sandwich, which they declined. She's 17 and then asked for a kid's menu to see if there were kid friendly dishes and was told it was for 12 and under and wasn't even allowed to see what other choices there were. The icing on the cake was to hear the waitress mock vegetarians to her regular customers by us. She said you don't want cheese on your salad then I will hold that. Btw, she's a vegetarian not vegan. We kept saying she just doesn't eat meat, but eats dairy. Then she asked if she wanted her to hold the olives and tomatoes. Maybe she didn't know what a vegetarian is. I asked if we could order her a cheeseburger and just hold the patty and she said "Why would you want to do that?".

I've lived in the valley off and on since 1990, and have eaten here without exaggeration at least 100 times.  This is true Texas to the bone!  I've pretty much had everything on the menu, and have never had anything I didn't like.  The Smoked Prime Rib is Stellar as are The Mashed Potatoes.  The Chicken Fried Steak and Chicken as well as the Catfish are the real deal.  They don't heavily season their food out of the kitchen.  Last time I checked that's what the salt and pepper on the table is for!  I personally like the Chili they serve as well, reminds me of the Classic Texas Brick Chili my Mom made when I was a kid.  The Atmosphere, decor is true Central Texas. You have to have lived there or visit a lot to truly appreciate The True Texas vibe of this place.  I'm truly at home here and will keep on coming back.  Steve and the gang have a great long standing tradition here. Anytime I have family or friends from Texas in town visiting I always bring them here, and they always leave with a smile on their faces just like I do... Very refreshing to have such a down home, feel good vibe Restaurant such as this in The Valley of The Sun.

Huge, tasty portions for very reasonable prices! Service 4/5; Food 4/5.

Food: I got the brisket sandwich, and my husband got the chicken fried steak. Massive, massive portions - you could easily get two meals out of each serving. The sandwich was nice and juicy, and I appreciated that the brisket was sliced instead of chopped. There was enough sauce & coleslaw to go with, too, so I didn't have to ask for more! My husband's steak was pretty good, but a little bit dry and chewy. I don't know whether he got a tougher cut, or whether that's standard here.

Service: Our waitress was nice, and patient about answering all our questions. Everything came out in a timely manner, and we were happy with the way we were treated. Nothing stellar, but perfectly reasonable. Other staff seemed friendly, too.

Other points of interest: The decor was really interesting and made for a good conversation piece, and we liked how unique the restaurant was. It definitely has its own culture. We'll probably be back sometime!
Go here - the food is really good. I had chicken fried steak + house salad for lunch today and it was as good a meal as I've had in a long time. You may need to hit the gym afterward, but worth it.

We hadn't been to Texaz in about ten years, so we thought it would be fun to take the kids last weekend. It's still crowded and with the animals, posters, newspaper articles on the walls and hundreds of ballcaps hanging from the ceiling, the atmosphere at Texaz is a genuine version of the type of place that chain restaurants pay designers big money to create. For kids, its a cornucopia of sights and sounds to look at which accounts for the two stars I'm giving it.

However, it doesn't get any more stars because the food has really gone downhill. Naturally my wife and I ordered the meal that this restaurant is famous for - chicken-fried steak with mashed potatoes and gravy and as I said, we hadn't been there in about ten years, but there is no way the food used to be this bland. Unfortunately, this was one of the most boring chicken-fried steaks I have ever had. The breading had no flavor and the gravy didn't add any either. I like good chicken fried steak, but this wasn't it. In fact, I'd be embarrassed to bring anyone from Texas to this place.

Sorry Texaz, I know you're a Central Phoenix institution, but you're riding on past glory.

You only need to know three words walking into TEXAZ Grill: chicken fried steak. It's a huge monster, with a crispy double dipped batter layer encasing a beautiful tenderized steak, smothered with a beautiful white gravy. Without a doubt TEXAZ Grill has the best chicken fried steak in the Phoenix area, perhaps even Arizona!

Portions are huge too! The dinner portion actually gives you two steaks while the lunch portion gives you one. The coleslaw and mashed potatoes on the side were huge as well.

The restaurant is a bit small and the parking lot a bit smaller, but the interior is definitely cozy and the staff is very friendly. It really makes the meal worth it on top of the kick*** CFS. You NEED to try this out!

Always awesome! Great service & atmosphere. Been here lots of times. One of the best fried chicken dinners in Phoenix (totally overlooked). Of course there's the smoked Prime Rib and the chicken fried steak, which are both terrific. For dessert, let me recommend the bread pudding or the calas with a cup of coffee. I just love this place.

The food is good, that's already been expressed. The service is amazing!!!! From the greeting, to bringing constant refills, to pleasing the children (nephew).  It's like going to a Deep South restaurant where the staff goes out of their way to make sure you're comfortable. It sounds cheesy, but I'll admit I was hesitant to go in this restaurant because it doesn't look friendly from the outside. So I guess my vibe reader was wrong. Oh- and great lemonade!

I was in the mood for steak, while in Phoenix on vacation. After reading the reviews on Yelp, we decided to try Texaz. It is a local restaurant, which is appealing to me. We both had the smoked prime rib. The meat was cooked to perfection and was very flavorful. The mashed potatoes with creamy gravy were, likewise, excellent. Portions were big. The service was great. The only downside was that parking was a little scarce when we were there, but please don't let that deter you. I'll definitely want to remember this restaurant the next time I visit Phoenix.

I have gone to Texaz Grill since they opened 35 years ago and they serve the best chicken fried steak anywhere.  The portion is so large even the Little Tex we always split the large and ask for a side of mashed potatoes. And the mac & cheese is the bomb for $6.00 is a meal in itself yum!

My husband has been hunting for a place where he could get chicken that he liked for years. He is crazy about the Chicken Fried Chicken here.  The gravy is wonderful, not pasty and paired with your choice of mashed potatoes or their own version of fries.  He loves the mashed potatoes.  I don't care for the fries. They're good tasting chunks of potato but don't resemble fries AT ALL.  Their burger is decent but the I don't like their club sandwiches.  They used good ingredients but instead of the traditional bread in layers its all just on a french roll bun.  Last time I got the Chicken Fried Chicken sandwich and enjoyed it.  Again the burger bun its on is sufficient but for a great piece of chicken like that better buns would help.  I loved the Bread Pudding in Whiskey Sauce for dessert.  We've always gotten the same waitress and have loved her.  She's pleasant, helpful and has a great attitude.

Coworker recommended this place to me. Turned out to be a very rare homerun here in Phoenix. Most restaurants inevitably disappoint, but this place was mega solid.

Service is really great. Nancy was our server and she is a true pro. Very nice change of pace to have an attentive and efficient waitress. This place runs like clockwork. 

Food was outstanding, and came out at just the right pace.

I love chicken fried steak, but I rarely order it because it never stacks up to the old Stroud's in Kansas City. Texaz does a very solid CFS. Giant, dinosaur sized piece of meat, cooked perfectly, just slightly under-seasoned, but overall awesome. I ate the entire thing, and I'm well under 200lbs. Coleslaw was near perfect, too.

My girlfriend had their ribeye. Cooked as ordered, very tasty. Her mashed potatoes were spot on. She was happy, and our dogs loved the connective tissue we brought home. 

Beer list is a little thin, but that's not why you would come here. Decor is cool; definitely reminds me of a lot of the hole-in-the-wall places I've eaten at in mid-sized Midwest cities. 

Pricing is good, but parking is shit. It's always busy for a reason, though. We came around 8p on a Tuesday, so luckily there was some parking and no waiting. If you come here during happy hour, best of luck! 

Highly recommended.
The anti-immigrant bumper sticker about abducting "illegal[s] was enough to ruin a meal.  Sending the steak back that came out raw didn't help.
Terrible salad as lettuce was wilted a bit.  Steak was so filled with marbleing that it was ineatable.  The cup of water was good.

You will be hard-pressed to find better value in a steakhouse than this place.  We had the smoked prime rib, and it was outstanding - smoky but not overpowering, tender, juicy, and HUGE.  We also had their famous chicken fried steak, and it was tender, flavorful, and the gravy was perfect.  And it was also huge.  People complaining about the price need to get out more, because you will not find better prices than these for anywhere near the quality or quantity.  Go early if you want the prime rib; we got there before 5:30 on a Thursday and they were nearly out.  They have happy hour on weeknights with half-price drinks, I had 2 glasses of  Mondavi red wine for a grand total of 4 measly bucks to wash down the prime rib with.  A real treat; we lived in Texas for years and this place could easily compete with the better steakhouses there.

Chicken Fried Steak!! WOW!! 

A huge portion, pounded perfectly tender, battered and deep fried to a flaky crust - just delicious! The Bread pudding with whiskey sauce was awesome as well. 
Staff was friendly and service was quick to the table. This place is an absolute old school phoenix gem.

We will be back to try the pork chops and steaks!!

FYI - parking can be tough - plenty of spots around back of building.

My wife and I stopped in last night for the Tuesday night special of beef back ribs. It had been maybe fifteen years since we had last been here, and was both looking forward to some good ribs. However last night the ribs where charred way to black outside. Literally charcoal black. We both had beef ribs, but at least two of the five on each plate where not eatable.   
Think forgotten under the broiler for way too long and then topped with lukewarm bbq sauce. 
I ordered steak fries and received quartered potatoes that where also hard and dry and bland.
Maybe I'll try back in another fifteen years.

We drove a little out of our way to visit Texaz Grill, but it was more than worth it. We both had the pecan smoked prime rib, which was heavenly.  Perfect rosy center, almost fork-tender, and the flavor--the best prime rib we ever had. Would like to sample other menu items when we return, but it'll be hard to resist the pr. We would like to have seen a cooked veggie on the plate. The mashed taters were great; the salad was OK. Our waitress was super nice and helpful. When my husband asked the best way to heat up his copious leftover meat, she suggested warming it is some of the au jus--then went to the kitchen and brought back  a little container of it. What a doll! I agree with others that you almost have to helicopter into the the parking lot. Next time we might look elsewhere and walk a little. Notwithstanding, I won't budge on my five stars for the food.
Great place! Just a hole in the wall with great food. Country Fried Steak was the best. My wife loved the catfish. We will be back
Went back recently, and it was just as good, if not better than I remembered.  I was too long in Las Vegas.  Price, portions and service are all excellent.  I just wish I lived closer.

Not many menu choices but we both ordered the chicken fried steak & could have shared one plate. We both had half our plates left over. That would have been nice to know ahead of time. The bread they serve before dinner is ok; it kept the kids occupied until the food came. The food we ordered was ok but I don't think we will be back. Slow waiter service as well.

We just left Texaz, and I just had a write a review because the experience was so amazing!  We were with a big party of 13 people ranging in ages from 3 to 40.  The owner came by and played trivia with all of the kids at the table and gave out prizes for the right answers. How often does something like that happen?  

Service - Our service was top notch!  We each ordered several courses and our server was always on top of drink refills, each order was correct, and we had to ask for nothing as she anticipated what each of us would need.  She was quiet but very thoughtful.

Food - Giant - Texas size portions, great tasting and very reasonably priced, considering our group was mostly teenagers what more could you ask for?  The chicken fried steak is amazing!!!

Décor/ambience - lots and lots of things on the wall and an infinite amount of Texas kitsch.

I would recommend Texaz for lunch or dinner any day of the week.  It was a great experience and the food was outstanding!

This place is known for their chicken fried steak.  And they certainly do it right.  They have a billboard that is a running tally of how many servings of chicken fried steak they have served....now that's confidence in your product!  But if you feel like something else, they have an amazing prime rib (you have to get there early though....they only make a certain amount of prime rib each night and when they run out, they run out).  If you want something a little smaller---and that's not saying much, since their portions are huge, get the brisket sandwich, ask for the bbq sauce on the side, and ask for a side of au ju.  You won't regret it.  It's amazing!!  

Don't expect some fancy schmancy steakhouse--but go hungry and you won't regret your decision to go there!

Wasn't crazy about this place. We started with fried okra & beer battered shrimp and for our main course we had the chicken fried steak, chicken fried chicken and brisket sandwich. From the kids menu, we ordered  smoked prime rib. And for dessert we ordered the peach cobbler.

For starters, the biscuits and rolls we got didn't taste fresh, in fact, they tasted like they'd been warmed up in a microwave. Already a terrible start. But it did get better with our apps. The fried okra was very good, the okra was ripe, not at all bitter. The beer battered shrimp was also very good, light batter, fresh shrimp, our meal was looking better.

Then dinner came, the chicken fried chicken was delicious, the chicken was juicy and battered very nicely. My chicken fried steak however, was very bland and there was so much more batter than meat. The gravy was very good and sort of made up for the steak. The brisket sandwich was very dry so we ordered a side of BBQ sauce, without it, it wasn't very appetizing, with it, it was pretty darn good, nothing fancy, just a lot of brisket and bread. The smoked prime rib from the kids menu was OK. It had a lot of fatty parts, I may be biased as I'm not a prime rib fan though. We could definitely taste the smoky flavor. We ordered a side salad with both steak dinners and they both tasted like bagged salad. Nothing great about the dressings either. The mashed potatoes that came with the steaks were pretty good, they had skin pieces which I personally love. No gravy, but I prefer mashed potatoes without so I was happy there.

My favorite dish of the evening was the peach cobbler. The peaches weren't fresh, they were frozen so I was slightly disappointed but the crust part made up for it. The crust, made from their biscuit batter, was slightly sweet and tasted just right with the peaches and vanilla ice cream, (adding ice cream is $1 extra).

Overall, I didn't hate this place but I certainly didn't love it. The portions are massive so go hungry or prepare to take lots of leftovers home.

I love this place.  My husband, daughter and I can all share one order of the chicken fried steak and still have leftovers.  Makes for a cheap dinner out.  The staff is wonderful and very good to our 3 year old.  They also have Shiner Bock Amber.  It doesn't get better than that.

I'm a transplanted Texas girl from Austin. I was craving a taste of home and saw reviews for this place. The atmosphere is great, the waitress was amusingly surly. Sadly the food was terrible. I don't understand actually having a disclaimer on your menu that you don't season your meat?! However that would explain the ridiculous amount of condiments at the table. I ordered the chicken fried steak and was saaaaaadddly disappointed. It is NOT authentic to not season this dish. It literally tasted like a cube steak dipped in a flour/water paste then deep fried. No self-respecting Texan would do this, and you certainly wouldn't add pepporcini pepper sauce or Cholula sauce to a real CFS!  The meat was not the only thing unseasoned, the chicken tenders, potatoes, biscuits and pretty much everything else was tasteless and so bad I couldn't eat it and I LOOOOVE anything fried, so this is pretty bad. We actually felt kind of bad for them when they saw how much food was on the table and we didn't want a take home box.   

I advise they add salt & pepper at the least.
The chicken Fried steak is out of this world. Absolutely delicious a nice place to get together with friends, enjoy.

We were staying in the Phoenix area for two months, and we came here on the recommendation of a neighbor. We waited until our very last night in the area to try Texaz, and boy, are we glad we didn't miss it. There were four of us, and we all ordered the chicken fried steak. Being a native Texan, I had to compare it to the unofficial state dish of Texas. It was hands-down the BEST I've ever eaten, and even the "small" portion was huge! The waitstaff is very friendly, and the super nice owner, Steve, came out of the kitchen to visit with us. It was a very enjoyable evening, and we will definitely go again when we're back in Phoenix.

What a great, unique place!  Smoked prime rib is fantastic - juicy, well seasoned, so tasty. Potato wedges are the perfect pairing. Very cold beer completes the Texas experience. Parking is a challenge but worth the trouble.

Besides the great food and service, I love the decor of this corner gem. I'm never disappointed! And I mean, NEVER. I took our youngest, for lunch, and he was mesmerized by all the memorabilia, on the wall and ceiling. It was entertaining, to see the look, on his face. I love it, when I get to surprise, our kids. Even though the youngest, just turned 30. Can't remember what he had, but he devoured, every last bite. I got the country fried steak, and it was enough, for 3 meals. 
This is another place, that has never been a disappointment. If you go, just make sure you go after the rush hour, or you'll have to wait in line. Not that it isn't worth the wait! I just lothe, lines. Go, go, go, and try this place out. Not only, is the food great, I never go, where I don't meet someone, interesting. Reminds me of my Mom & Grandma's restaurant, in Central Illinois,  back in the 50's & 60's. ENJOY!

My wife and I decided to give this place a try one afternoon after seeing this place for years. One of the major issues we have with places that serve chicken fried steak is that the gravy is usually not very flavorful nor is the steak itself. I'm very pleased to say this place surprised us both. 

It is very obvious that this place puts a lot of hard work and passion into their food. The batter covering the steak was delicious and the meat inside was seasoned up proper and tender. And that gravy covering it? I am licking my lips thinking about it as it had just the right amount of pepper and not overbearing in salt at all! The waitress was super friendly, even gave us a sample of their Texas style chili so we could see what the difference was. 

And the mashed potatoes....were just like the ones my mother would serve on Thanksgiving day; skin on, so you know they're real and lumpy with a delicious butter and pepper taste to them. I'm willing to wager they probably use milk in them just to make them extra fluffy. 

I got the chicken fried steak and my wife got their barbeque sampler. Ribs were a smidge salty but I'm still giving these guys a five star review because it felt so nice eating at a no frills, down home place. I'll make sure next time we go in to save room for their dessert as I do love bread pudding.

This is one of my husbands favorite places for chicken fried steak. I'm not much for fried food, so I didn't order anything. But then my husband ordered his steak, fed me a bite and I remember being startled because it was fresh - not frozen. You could TASTE that it was not frozen. Probably the first restaurant I've been to that didn't have pre-frozen fried food. It's also beer battered. Flippin' delicious. It's basically like going to a southern mama's house and going for a home cooked meal.

Wow, those are big portions. Great food and service. Prices were decent, and the atmosphere was awesome. The catfish and ribeye are worth the trip. Daily specials are a good value with a tinning it home cooking.

Coming from California and came across Texaz. Great food and amazing service! Come with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food! Matt was extremely friendly and welcoming. Definitely recommend it for other newcomers

Texas is more known for its sliced brisket, but I was there at lunch and they only had the chopped brisket sandwich available for $6.99 with a side of twice baked potato wedges. Those wedges were crispy and above average, but the brisket was just average in the chopped form. Not sure why Texas places cannot replicate Southern chopped brisket, but it is never as good as down south or southern style places. It wasn't horrible, but the BBQ sauce was watery and did not add much and the bottom bun was soaked through, so no way was this going to be eaten sandwich style. The place was decorated with animal heads and other crazyiness and the parking lot is a very tight squeeze if your there at the wrong time. The waitress was very nice though and it's worth another visit to try something else.

Great place to get delicious Rib Eye and Prime Rib. The portions are good size and the food was good. Coming from San Diego I wished there was a place like this nearby us. All of the staff there was very friendly and pleasant and gave good service. I would try again when back in town.

I grew up in Texas and love coming here for the brisket and the chicken fried steak. The catfish is also worth getting. Very friendly service. The table is loaded with all sorts of hot sauces and condiments to add some kick to your meal. Parking is poor if not awful and the lighting inside is rather dim. Ask for a seat to the left when you walk in by the lamp and beer signs. Oh Yeah!

Four stars for the food. 

This place is known for their chicken fried steak which is what I had. For me, a little too much breading and not nearly enough gravy. The flavor however was legit. Better than homemade. (I couldn't stand my step mothers chicken fried steak. Lol). 

The plate came with mashed potatoes that were outstanding!  And corn which was as one would expect, and a buttermilk biscuit (nothing to write home about). We got an order of fried okra and that was fantastic. Just the right breading and the dipping sauce was out of this world!

The atmosphere here is of a style I like. Kind of divey, and full of nostalgia. Service was really good, and maybe just a little "too" attentive. 

Fun place though!  I'll be back. I want to try their bbq brisket.
Soo good! The atmosphere and the service was great. The chicken fried steak is amazing!  Puts me to sleep every time. A must try.

I have passed it 50 times or so and finally I stopped in to check it out. Well it was nothing like I expected once I opened the door. The place is crammed with dusty Texas stuff from the ceiling down the walls and on the counters. It's a bit over done for my taste. 
The bar sits back from the door along one wall and is small and cramped all other seating appeared to be cramped booths. They offer daily supper specials, but on this evening it was the least appealing of them all. Wednesday Supper Special is Liver & Onions, I don't do Liver & Onions. Instead I had dessert! All desserts are $3.50 unheard of in restaurants anymore! I had the Homemade Hill Country Peach Cobbler, it comes warm so for an extra buck I went A La Mode and had a hefty scoop of Blue Bell Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream. It's a real tasty cobbler and a good size one as well. Tammy the bartender was friendly and quick to serve as well as chat with ya. All the staff seemed pretty easy going and TEXAZ friendly. The menu has a tasty looking line up for both lunch and dinner. Lunch (mostly $7) is substantially less than dinner ($12 - $20) in prices. But one time or another I'll be back to try that awesome looking chicken fried steak or some fried fish or some BBQ spareribs. The place seems mighty fine for down home Texan cookin and it hasn't got a Good Ole Boys feel to it at all, as one person had told me it would.

I really love Comfort Food sometimes!!  And this is AWESOME!  The Chicken Fried Steak, Mashed Potatoes, it is really all good!   And so comfortable inside, so much to look and such a nice change from all of the modern stainless stuff around.  Down home & Comfort food!   Oh and if you have them cook you up a  prime rib for a family get together!  Wow it's great!  :)

Chicken-fried steak and a Shiner bock doesn't get much more Texas then this. Chicken-fried steaks are huge and you get two of them and some of the best southern bread pudding around. Take some time look around at all the Texas flair on the walls and say hi to the armadillo that greets you at the door.

Texaz Grill has possibly the best chicken fried steak in the state. Their chop steak burgers and ribs are good too. 

I would not recommend getting an actual steak here though. 

I have had mixed experiences with the staff. Some have been rude and uninspired, others have been extremely friendly and helpful. 

The bottom line for me is Texaz grill is my destination of choice for chicken fried steak and ribs. If I am in the mood for a New York Strip or something along those lines, I prefer to go to a chain restaurant.

You won't find better liver & onions anywhere. Cooked perfect, lots of it. Waitresses are the best. The cook however doesn't know when food is done. I've had 6 meals here and anything fried is going to look picture perfect and be uncooked. I know my catfish and this is almost warm on the inside when the coating is perfect. They pride themselves on the chicken fried steak but can't seem to let the batter finish frying. I've tried it over and over and it's always been underdone. My guess is that since I eat there between 2 and 6pm each time, they have the least experienced kitchen person at the fryer. i like to go to local places and will go back here, but i expect i'm going to bang my head on the wall for doing it.

TexAz Grill is the number one restaurant in the entire world.  Just go there everyday and order everything.  Then get coffee and desert. I love the dinner salad, it comes with always perfectly ripe tomatoes and green olives.  I order it with ranch, and add salt and pepper.  Holy cow it is good.  I like all the entrees and specials, order with beer, and chase with coffee, and peach cobbler.  Home run.  Must check this place.

Wow. I have been bragging to my husband about how great this place was for chicken fried steak. I used to go there with coworkers several years ago for lunch. Had such fond memories of the best chicken fried steak I have ever had. 

What happened?  The place was only half full as opposed to having to wait quite awhile for a seat awhile back. We both ordered the CFS and waited anxiously for it to arrive (short wait). What a disappointment. The breading was soggy and somewhat tasteless. The steak overflowed the plate and the gravy was lacking flavor.  Disappointed.
Used to be one of our favs but has gone south very fast. Last two times we have been there the food was not edible. Something is very wrong.

I'm from Vegas visiting my daughter and granddaughter so I stopped by for a margarita on a very hot and humid day. Nice and cool inside but so was the service. Of course I'm a female from out of town so I noticed the male locals received better service. My drinks were good but the ladies were very uptight. Not comfortable at all! Could've been the disabled guest that set them off... if so that's even more un-cool! I'll never go back!

This place is consistently good. I don't think I have ever had a bad meal here. The chicken fried everything is pretty tasty along with the club that has brisket on it. I try to go here at least a few times a month for lunch.

Went and checked out the place last Saturday. The ambiance is rustic I think. Parking was tricky and definitely not friendly unless you have a compact. The hostess was very friendly. Since the place supposedly has great chicken fried steak, that's what I ordered. To say the portion is ginormous is an understatement. You get two of them that the size as big as your head. The breading's texture is great with a nice crunch. The steak is very tender and not dry. My only complaint would be that the food is BLAND! The breading definitely could've used some flavor or spice and so did the gravy. Odd that the steak is such huge portion but the gravy is very much skimped on. I liked it, but it definitely could use some major seasoning. Maybe they can steal it from Chili's. Even though Chili's is a chain, they have one of the best chicken fried steak I've had. Texaz grilled would've definitely got 4 stars if they seasoned the CFS.

The service at this restaurant is some of the best I've seen in the valley. The moment you walk in the door you are greeted warmly from servers, the hostess and even the manager/owner... I'm still not quite sure who he was but everyone was amazing and friendly from the moment we walked in until the moment we left. Our server was like a second mom, doting on our boys and always making sure we had everything we needed. I chose this restaurant for my birthday dinner because I knew we'd be going out with our two small boys and thought it would be a fun experience for everyone. I ordered the chicken fried steak because that is what they're famous for. It was a gigantic and I could only finished half of it. I would highly suggest if you don't have a Texas size appetite to do the half order or split it with someone. A little detail to most but a big thing for me was that they served green olives chopped up on their dinner salad and I loved it. We will definitely be back. My only negative on this restaurant is the lack of parking space, but this is a common issue in the central Phoenix area.

I was craving for country fried steak and drove to this restaurant to fulfill it. As you enter the restaurant you will notice the hats, license plates, nostalgic Texas decoration. It feels like you've been transformed into a Texas country bar. We were immediately greeted by the hostess and sat down inside of a booth. The menu is right side up on the table. Inside the menu are comfort foods to order such as, chicken fried steak, fried okra, steak and burgers. Of course, I ordered the chicken fried steak with the gravy on the side; it was so delicious. Five stars!! It was good enough to feed two people. Additionally, the bread pudding is served warm with whiskey sauce. It was a perfect ending to dinner when you're all fried up!

I've been wanting to hit up TEXAZ Grill for a while and finally got a chance to last week for lunch. Had read about their chicken fried steak and my mouth was watering before I arrived just thinking about it. Unfortunately, I was completely underwhelmed by my plate. The portion was large and reasonably priced for lunch, but everything on the plate was so bland. The CSF also tasted more stale instead of having a nice, crispy crunch. My friend had the catfish poboy which wasn't anything special. I'll give them the home-fried potatoes...nice crisp outside and perfectly cooked inside. Waitress was friendly and efficient. Prices are a lot more expensive for dinner. Probably won't be back.

If you are a person like me who likes a lot of variety this is NOT the place for you.. 3 different items I wanted they ran out of and what they did have was not that great.  I ordered the prime rib sandwich which was more more that 4 strips of prime rib placed on top of a French roll which tasted like onion because they put a giant thicker slice of onion under it. The mashed potatoes were okay nothing g special. We also ordered the frito pie. It was nothing more the a tiny bag of Fritos with a small amount t of chili dumped inside. Will never go back
Not color friendly if you get my drift. Just speaking the truth.

Best food in the valley! I love this place! I go there about twice a month! I would go there more often but I live in Tempe. This place is worth the drive if you live within a hour of this place. I would eat there three times a week if it was in my neck of the woods! Way to Tex az you got a customer for life!!!!!
Very good food! The décor is very busy with a cluttered distracting allure. Kind of a dive bar type ambiance.

I'm so in love with the Chicken Fried Chicken, it's juicy and delicious. I admit it's really my favorite thing to eat here. I always think about, maybe switching things up, ordering something else. But no, I can't it's just too amazing. Ok so I've mistakenly ordered the fried steak, which turned out to be a happy accident. It too, tasted great. I've also tried, bites of other dishes, and pretty much everything tastes great. Portions are really generous. I usually end up boxing up about half of my meal. The salad and bread, do me in almost every time. Texaz has a "Clean Plate Club Card" sadly, I only have few stamps, I doubt I'll ever fill it. Even if I did, I wouldn't be able to enjoy the desert that's rewarded when your card is fully stamped. 

My Family has enjoyed eating at Texaz for many years now. Texaz is always amazing, every single time!

We have been going to this place for years. It is my fiance's favorite restaurant and the place he requests for his birthday dinner every year. We came here for Valentine's even though it was a bit of a drive and once again, worth the gas! My steak was cooked to perfection and everything was on point including the service.. And the prickly pear margaritas!! And you get free cake on Valentine's?! Say what?!! I think this will be a new Valentine's tradition!!!

Best chicken fried steak ever!!! They have huge portions, great service, and the food is delicious. One if my favorite parts is the atmosphere inside. It's a really cool spot. Owners are always there working and walking around. Awesome spot!

*phoenix foodies approved

Yes! The best preparation for a chicken fried steak I have had in Phoenix so far.  With that said the gravy was lacking in flavor.  Whether this was intentional or not, I had to put a lot of salt and pepper on it to taste the gravy.

The atmosphere is what you would expect from a diner.  Trucker hats and outdated memorabilia galore. The best part of the experience was the owner/chef coming out to converse with everyone in the restaurant to see how the food was.  Props for that!  The staff was also very friendly and attentive.  

Plan in gaining a pound or two when eating here.  I give this 4 stars for the great home style cooking you would expect from a noted local restaurant.  Minus one star for possibly having a little too high of expectations of the food.

Peach cobbler hands down the best. Son likes fried catfish and chicken fried chicken.

I like the ambiance like a dive kind of place

Best food for hungry man....that's for sure. He's only 18, but my hungry man son likes big portions and lots of heavy foods. 
Susan, night manager is super nice too.

First time here after many recommendations. Tried the Chicken Fried Steak. It did not disappoint! Huge and delicious. The chef came out to check on our meal to make sure it was to our liking. Great service, and great food!

Sometimes, predictable is a good thing.
A dear friend moved away and was coming to visit for a weekend. Turns out, despite being a sucker for anything chicken fried, she had never heard of TEXAZ. So we put together a small dinner party (8 of us) to celebrate her being in town.

The server was fantastic! We all came in at different times, she never missed a beat with greeting us, getting us drinks and taking care of all the substitutions and special requests in our food order. Everything arrived exactly as ordered - and we were a happy and full group of people.

The food is still consistent, the ambiance is still kitschy Texas roadhouse dive, the prices are still very reasonable and I am still super happy TEXAS is in my hood.

They don't make steakhouses like this anymore, fitting because you can't find this food anywhere else but TEXAZ Grill on 16th st and Bethany. Sure the parking lot is tiny and the original 70/80's decor is now full cycle into hip retro territory but by all that is righteous and proper in this world their CHICKEN FRIED STEAK and CHICKEN FRIED CHICKEN (yup, fried chicken breasts) is mind numbingly delicious. 

This place is a must have for any true local Phoenician. Leave your ego at the door, they don't care. Comfortable and better than home. Good for the whole family or yourself looking for a meal.

I've been to TEXAZ grill for dinner in the past but this is the first time for brunch. Once again they didn't disappoint. There were 6 in our group we ordered:

3) Chicken Fried Goodness - House specialty - choice of tenderized beef steak, boneless chicken breast or boneless pork loin chop, double dipped, fried, and covered with cream gravy. Served with award winning mashed potatoes and gravy, corn and a buttermilk biscuit.  We tried all 3 meat types all the plates were great.

2) Biscuits and Gravy - Two buttermilk? biscuits covered in sausage gravy. Great taste, fresh biscuits and plenty of sausage in the gravy.

1) Bacon or Sausage & Eggs - Bacon or hot country sausage patty with 2 eggs cooked to order & a biscuit.  Eggs cooked perfectly, great tasted sausage and fresh biscuit.

If you're looking for a place of elegance, this is not the place for you.  It's dark, dingy and a hole in the wall ..... and the food is AMAZING.  Five of us went in for lunch on a Friday afternoon (one being a former Texan, only just moving to Arizona two months ago) and the wait for a table was non-existent.  Our service was very good and attentive.  Three of us ordered the chicken fried steak and two of us ordered the BBQ brisket sandwich.  Every single one of us was extremely pleased with our food and SO MUCH FOOD.  I would definitely recommend this place for some good Texan food!  Prices were unbelievably reasonable as well.

There's probably not a lot that can be said about TexAz Grill that hasn't been said, but  I feel the need to put in a good word for their catfish. It's great - perfectly battered, flaky, great flavor and the two massive fillets are enough to share with a friend, making it a fairly inexpensive, reasonably healthful dinner for two.

Today was my free birthday lunch. I had an extremely rare rib eye and Julie had the massive chicken fried steak. It was pretty quiet the day after Thanksgiving. Service is excellent. Limited beer menu. Great desserts
We live on the west side so only come over for special events. Great decor. Its too bad they took the vintage fishing lures of the mirror in the mens room. Guess they got stolen. It was pretty unique

Once again some time has passed before we came here for dinner but we find ourselves happy we made our way back. The meal starts off with a simple salad and some fabulous biscuits and the entree was a massive serving of chicken fried chicken. We left happy and stuffed. The service was friendly efficient and there is a lot of look at on the walls and ceiling. It does appear that the menu is much smaller since our last visit but we got what we went there for so that was no concern to us.

I LOVE chicken fried steak and a family friend told me I HAD to try this place. And I'm so happy I did so.  The chicken fried steak was delicious. The batter was light and crispy, the steak was moist and the country gravy, to die for.  I've had plenty of chewy chicken fried steak in my life with mediocre gravy. This was definitely the BEST chicken fried steak I've ever had. The waitress was super busy as they bus their own tables, but we never felt neglected. I just noticed how busy she was.  So the fact that she was slammed and her service never suffered was huge to me.  The manager or maybe the owner was coming around to all the tables and asking everyone how the food was and chatting with the regulars. I love that type of service. We raved about the food and told him it was our first time in and he gave me and my mother a card for a free dessert on our next visit!!  So what else can I do BUT give this place 5 stars.  Wonderful home cooking and great service.
We had the rib eye and the chicken fried steak. Both entrees were delicious, great flavor, cooked to perfection. You will not be disappointed!

The food is so good that I wish I could eat there every day. I love their lunch time specials.  Tuesday is a must for ham steak  Wednesday is a must for liver and onions .  Thursdays for ribs or prime rib (almost a half pound).  Friday is the best fish in town.
Nancy, the werver is simply great!

A long standing landmark that I recently visited for lunch was found to be a real treat. I have given this establishment 4 stars not for the venue or the ambiance of the furnishings, but, for the quality of the food, service and the wholesomeness of the experience. The food is home cooked and portions are very generous.  Their chicken fried steak is one of the main stays of this business. I had that item for my lunch. I took home the remains of my lunch and my wife and finished for lunch the next day. The steak hangs over all sides of the plate. The price of $9 was  a real bargain. 
If in the area or if you want to try a restaurant that represents what the old west was about 50 years ago, this is the place. Nothing fancy just good fixins.

Positive: The portion size are huge, especially the chicken fried steak. Service was quick however food was warm.
Negative: The establishment has hats and business cards hanging all over the place from the ceiling, thousands of them...all I can think of is 'dust and dirt.' Also, I heard one waitress say "stupid table!" and another one say "dickhead!" behind me at my table. Unsure who they were referring too. 
Overall: Food is good, service needs to be more friendlier and establishment needs to look cleaner.

Fun, friendly, prompt service and tasty food? What's not to like? Portions here are definitely Texas-size so you are not going to go away hungry. They were very accommodating to our large party and our server was excellent. 

Parking here is HORRIBLE though. The restaurant is on the corner of 16th St. and Bethany Home in a rundown strip mall. The spots themselves are short and it's difficult to get into and out of the lot. Not sure if there is a special trick to parking here but please keep in mind when you come that parking is sucky. 

Now, bear in mind when you come here, there are not many "healthy options" on the menu. And they are not ashamed of this at all. They embrace the Texas size deep fried, heavily battered foods they offer unabashedly. As someone who is careful about what I eat, I did manage to get a salad and felt good about it. All the dishes came out at the proper temperatures and were freshly made and nicely plated. 

Looking forward to going back in the near future!

This place is great and Steve, the owner, is always there and stops by to chat often.  I ALWAYS have the chicken fried chicken sandy with longhorn cheddar.  Fantastic!  They have a secret sauce that goes well with the sandy, its basically a glorified thousand island.  It comes with a side of the house gravy that I use with the potatoes.  The wife ALWAYS has the catfish and she just loves it.  The soup yesterday was a Mexican cheese soup, tomato based with spices and longhorn cheddar.  Let me tell you that this soup was out of this world.  I will be checking the website often to see when it is back and will surly go have it again.  Most of the soups are great and every day there are different specials.  Definitely have to check this place out if you have not been.
Best food ever! Get the chicken fried steak and the smoked prime rib! Peach cobbler is amazing too! The atmosphere and hospitality in here are great. Try the homemade titos vodka.

First time here, been meaning to try it for years.  The fried okra is good, as was the coleslaw.  I ordered the "small" chicken fried chicken with mashed potatoes, it was delish.  Couldn't finish it.   Boyfriend had the regular order of Chicken fried steak and it was huge.  Couldnt finish it. Our waitress was SUPER nice and the food and drinks came timely.  Great hospitality, great food.  Yummy comfort food, country restaurant with a very inviting and homeie feel.  We will eat here again.

Found this on Yelp & decided we HAD to come check it out. I'm a huge fan of chicken fried chicken, I know everyone said this was known for the steak but I figured they would both be great.  I was correct! Our server & all other staff we came in contact with was super sweet. Our food came out piping hot exactly how we ordered it. Huge pieces of chicken, my husband & I could of easily shared it. Only complaint was the breading fell off of every piece I would cut. Eh. Oh well. We will def be back.

I ordered my meal and within three minutes there is my plate of chicken fried steak wow I thought three big giant pieces of chicken fried steak until I go to move it and I realize it's one piece and the coating which was practically not cooked had peeled right off. I have a 7 year old granddaughter who does a lot better job at making chicken fried steak.

I gotta give it to TEXAZ for the huge portions that come out of that kitchen, very Texan indeed. I could seriously split an entrée if I was pretty hungry, and I don't say that much. So, do yourself a favor and don't be worried about how many calories you're about to intake when you visit this establishment.

Now, the food itself was okay. I was seriously expecting an explosion of chicken fried steak in my face! I was ready for pure sodium sin that would allow my taste buds to dance in circles around every morsel with pitch forks raised in true devil worshiping style. This was probably why I wasn't insanely impressed. The steak itself was pretty good, but the gravy wasn't what I expected at all. I've been spoiled in the past with overwhelmingly flavorful sausage gravy with biscuits, and that's what I was expecting. So be warned if you're expecting something similar to that. But, again mentioning portions, that was the biggest chicken fried steak that I've ever had.

Fried okra, a dinner salad and their red chili were also chosen off the menu that night. The okra was pretty good, just battered and deep fried, and served with some sort of sauce (I didn't examine it well enough to say what it was). The salads were pretty good, but go for the vinaigrette because the ranch was sort of bland. Oh, and be prepared for a lot of dressing. Lastly, the chili...it was served the proper way with cheese and onions, which was nice, but I wasn't blown away with the flavor of this either. In all honesty, it seemed like they meant to cook it with MGD, but didn't cook all of the alcohol out...it was essentially beer flavored chili.

I'm going to go back to TEXAZ for sure (waitress was pretty sweet by the way), but I think my next visit will be for lunch. Some of their sandwiches look fantastic, and I'm really hoping to become a big fan of TEXAZ after trying some of them.

Amazingly delish! I couldn't even begin to tell you how yummy all the food was. Totally coming back! Had the Chicken Fried Chicken, but coming back for the Prime Rib and Pork Chop!!! Must come and visit!!

Holy smokes!  I ate here tonight and wow.  It has been several years since I have been to TEXAZ and now I wonder why I don't go at least once a year.  My poor heart is working hard tonight.  I had the chicken fried steak and split a shrimp cocktail.  

The shrimp was fresh and huge.  The steak was delicious and I love their mashed potatoes and country gravy.  The portions are gigantic and very affordable.  I will have to visit at least once a year. I think that is all my poor heart and arteries can handle.

Coolest restaurant! Neat atmosphere, awesome service. I had the chicken fried chicken and it was really good. Would definitely recommend to others stopping by town or people who live here. I've heard it's best to get there earlier if you want the steaks!

I was looking forward to trying this place for a long time.  The reviews on Yelp were good and I was told by a fellow steak lover that if I wanted a great (not the best) cut of steak at a reasonable price, then Texaz is the place to go.  I went on a Thursday evening and the place was pretty busy.  I was seated right away by a very friendly hostess.  You could tell from the looks of the place that it had been around a while.  I could have sworn my booth was going to fall apart, but it was ok.  The décor is a bit eccentric with anything and everything having to do with Texas all over the walls.  All the patrons seemed to be having a good time and enjoying their meals.  There were also plenty of wait staff bustling around.

While everything on the menu sounded delicious (but NOT diet friendly), I opted for the filet.  Next time I am going to order the prime rib or the chicken friend steak because I hear those are excellent.  My salad came quickly and was very good.  However, it was a bit odd because it contained diced green olives (which I normally don't like), but I said what the heck and ate it all anyway.  I was pleasantly surprised.  When the steak arrived I was surprised again at the size.  I was expecting it to be much smaller but it was a pretty big cut.  I'm guessing around 8-10oz.  I love it when steaks are cooked in plenty of butter (gross to some people...I know) and I guess this place knew that because there was plenty of the hot, melty goodness all over the steak and plate!  It was soooo good but soooo unhealthy.  It was cooked perfectly and I ate every bite.  The potatoes were just ok but I ate them anyway.  Nothing a bunch of salt and ketchup couldn't fix.  For dessert I ordered the homemade pecan pie and it was probably among the best I have ever had.

If you are looking for an upscale steak/bbq joint then this is NOT the place for you.  If you are looking for place with some good meat with good prices and excellent service, then this is the place for you.

My FAVORITE!  Best Catfish, Best Friday Fish and Chips, Best Peach Cobbler; as well as all the other goodies on the Menu. I bring all my friends from out of town here. The serving staff is friendly, and stable (meaning that they've been there for years...). They all know me by name and are wonderful. Steve the owner always hangs out meeting his guests too. If looking for a very reasonably priced American (Texas/southern) Café, then this is the place. You will be delighted. Its been open over 25-years, same owner, and the quality is consistently superior. Its the treat I've given myself every week for over 15-years.
Excellent service, fun atmosphere, friendly staff, food choices were enormous, food was plentiful and delicious.

I love the chicken fried steak! Me and the wife could have definitely split it. It would have been plenty for 2 people. The ambience is ok but the food makes up for it. 

As all the other reviews say "get the chicken fried steak!"

This place has great comfort food, nothing fancy but I don't expect nor want it from a place like this. We have been here twice and both times were excellent. The first time around I ordered the chicken fried steak and it was flavorful not to mention massive. This last time I decided to change things up and get the catfish, and I have to say this was easily the best catfish I've gotten from a restaurant, it is perfectly seasoned and melts in your mouth. Catfish isn't my favorite fish and far too many places can't make it properly, the sweetness of the catfish almost overpowers things. Not here, the flavor of the breading and the work in harmony. I will definitely get catfish again here! Oh yeah, their Texas Potatoes (or whatever they are called) are good as well, basically they are potato chunks that are fried, in fact I am willing to bet they double fry them to give the outerlayer a crispy texture. 

The restaurant itself resembles your typical small town restaurant, and that is fine with me since I grew up with restaurants like it. Their walls are covered with pictures, posters, signs and whatever else they can put up on it, it gives it an unique look. If you want a "nice" restaurant then you better look elsewhere, but if you want a hometown family restaurant and bar setting this is your place.

Service is fantastic as well, our server was constantly refilling our drinks and extremely friendly. One nice aspect of this place is that they give you large glasses for your beverage, so you usually only need a refill or two, we had a bit more because we were recovering from the summer heat.  Also for the record they carry Pepsi products, which is a bonus for me, but may not be for others.

In regards to price, they aren't cheap (the chicken fried steak is around 13 and the catfish for two big filets was around 12), but you will have more then enough food so it works out in the long run. 

Overall a great small town style restaurant and bar if you are looking for a hearty meal that is made right.

Cool place Absolutely filled with Texas memorabilia. Authentic Texas diner style food. I had the Brisket sandwich which was very big and delicious. My dining companions had the Chicken Fried Steak which was gigantic and delicious. They have Shiner Bock beer(Texas Beer). Parking is a bit tight but worth it. Lunch prices are very reasonable.
Four Stars. I will be back to try more.
Great chicken fried steak in phoenix but if it was in Texas it would be just good

I have been eating here for years. Great food.  Portions are smaller than they where a few years ago, and the pricing has gone up. The mashed potatoes and country grave is second only to my mothers. My kids can share the chicken fried chicken. So much chicken!

This is simply the best Chicken Fried Steak in phoenix - and the Steaks are good too. Definatly one of my top 10 favorites.

We often visit for lunch which is quite reasonably prices and exceptionally good. So finding a higher price for dinner was supurising untill the waitress informed us that they didnt give you one huge/gigantic chicken fried steak but two. I had to try to eat both but found it impossible - but was good the next day for lunch. I would have tried for breakfast but found myself still too full.

The food is Superb
The Service is Superb
The Atmosphere is Great

Have eaten the Steaks here as well - as good a most steakhouses
The ribs are very good as well - on par with most bbq places
The Red Eye gravy - just try it, will suprise you how good it is

If you read my profile, in the section that states last meal on earth it says - chicken fried steak.   Which just happens to be the specialty of the house here so 1 + 1 = chicken fried steak for dinner at the Texaz Grill.   

Like some of the other reviews say the portions are "Texas size"  and they ain't lying.  Over all the meal was good - 2 huge slabs of chicken fried steak, real mashed potatoes, tasty biscuits and a Shiner Bock or two to wash it down.  I rolled out of the place and still am in a food coma.

It's a beef place. I get it.  BUT....yours truly was in the mood for Catfish so I took a chance and WON!

This catfish was super crispy on the outside. Fluffy and plump on the inside. Just delicious.  Added a side of creamy peppery thin cut coleslaw and some chunky potatoes.  Tabasco, Lemon, Tartar Sauce.........tastebuds are happy.

First time ever tried Bread Pudding (YUM) and a Booker's Single Barrel Bourbon on the side was a perfect finish to a perfect meal.

I work at the sundevil auto right down the street. Me and my techs eat here 2 to 3 times a week !!!!  The service is absolutely amazing and the food is to die for !!! If I was not worried about having a heart attack from the delicious food I would eat here every day !!!!   Well done and keep it up.

This place is spot on!  Great service, salad and the chicken fried steak is out of this world!  We are here from Texas and have certainly had our fair share of excellent chicken fried steak, this place does it right!  Huge servings and incredible flavor!  Give this one a try!  You won't be disappointed!

Chicken Fried Steak, Chicken Fried Steak, Ribeye, Chicken Fried Steak. I've been have chicken fried steak here since they opened and it hasn't changed in all these years. The food is awesome, I've never had bad service and the quantity is fantastic. I love getting the box of left overs for tomorrow lunch.
I almost deducted a star because of parking, but decided it's worthy of all 5 because at least my car has AC to wait for a space. 
PS, be sure and save enough room for the pecan pie, its wonderful.
I had the lunch special, cermitas, it was phenomenal! One of the best bbq sandwiches I've had ever. The prices are great, especially for the amount of food served. Service was speedy & friendly.

TexAZ Grill does one thing & does it well: STEAK. (Actually, they'll cook yours to order, not just well.) 

You'll get a reasonably priced, delectably tender portion of your favorite cut of meat. Their mashed & baked potatoes are good, so is the coleslaw. Salads are lackluster, mostly iceberg lettuce, cardboard-like tomatoes, served as a vehicle for the dressing. But you don't go to TexAZ for rabbit food, you go for meat. And Texas beer. 

Best steak within 20 miles. 

Used to be the best deal around, too, but as of mid-2008, prices have been raised - plan on $20+ per person if you want a meal and a beer, $14-17 per person if you just drink water.

I seriously cannot think of a reason to deduct a star from Texaz. It's about as authentic as you can get without going back in time.  The food is consistent and delicious. I'm a purist so I used to order the chicken fried steak but have since broadened my horizons and have started ordering the chicken fried chicken which is, in my opinion, better. I also really appreciate the fact that they started offering half orders because their regular portion sizes are ginormous (though the leftovers are also delicious). 

This is probably one of my more boring reviews because I don't have anything to snark about with Texaz.  I actually joined their email list just because they seem like nice people and I'd like to hear from them more often.  Their food also cures all hangovers and it is the absolute perfect place to go on Sunday night after a long weekend of liver damage in Vegas (learned this last weekend). Five Stars.

Had dinner here the other night. What a cool concept - with all the decor, I truly felt I was in the heart of Texas!

We ordered the smoked prime rib meal, which included biscuit and roll, salad, mashed potatoes/gravy and prime rib. The prime rib was done perfectly, and had a great smoky flavor. Big big portions too. My only complaint would be that my prime rib was just a tad cool (temperature) - should have been a little warmer. But at least it wasn't overcooked!

Great atmosphere, and fun place.

Good honest food.   I don't know what I could possibly say that hasn't been said already.   Go and see for yourself.   I'd get the prime rib any day of the week.   The chicken fried pork and chicken is great as well.   Real mashed potatoes and creamy chicken gravy are just perfect.   Try the bread pudding if you have any room left,  but I bet you won't.
Perfect.  Authentic. Delicious. What more can you say. If you are familiar with Texas food, this joint is great.

We came here after seeing this resturant on check please.  They did not have the rice balls which you only get on Sunday my wife and I thought that this was an ok restaurant here everything looked really good on Check Please but after we got there most of the things were really without a lot of flavor. The chicken fried steak and chicken fried chicken was very crispy but they didn't have much flavor. Our dinner mates felt the same way about the chicken and sides. Lots of food, but the flavor was lacking.

This restaurant is very good if you are looking for a hearty meal with large portions. The chicken fried steak is the bomb - the best in Arizona. The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is unique. I just wish it was closer to my home in Gilbert. Highly Recommended.
Very good chicken fried steak. Okra. And mashed potatoes. Makes great leftovers if you can't finish!

Our new favorite restaurant! The food was amazing, the staff was incredible, and there just arent enough good things to say about TexAZ Grill! My only regret is that I we hadn't  tried it sooner. Please put a location in the West Valley!!
Good food and large portions. Ordered the prime rib it was so soft and juicy. Hubby ordered rib eye his was soft and yummy. Has a real Texas road house feel to the restaurant. Excellent food.
I like such places. This is a place for locals and families. The food was good and quickly came out. They are famous for their chicken fried steak. The serving size is very generous.

Being Texas-transplants, we'd been wanting to try TEXAZ Grill for some time, (but it's pretty far from the 'Copa). Upon entering, we thought we'd found another treasure like the renowned Babe's Fried Chicken as the décor is really cool, and there is a friendly, upbeat vibe. 

Our waitress was super! 

Two glasses of Chardonnay were very good, and a bargain for $5 each. 

As others have mentioned, the portions are HUGE, and the mashed potatoes, biscuit and corn were excellent! 

Unfortunately, the stars of the show, Chicken Fried Steak and Chicken Fried Chicken were just fair. The CFS was the biggest disappointment as it lacked proper seasoning, and was pounded way too thin which causes over-breading. The CHC was better and was perfectly cooked, but a bit over-breaded and needed more seasoning as well (Churches or Popeyes is better). 

As any Texan well knows, you can hide a lot of mediocre food under outstanding gravy (sorry Mom) but we found the gravy slightly sweet for our palettes. 

We will certainly be back to try the brisket as it smelled great!

I've been eating here since I was a kid...we'd drive from 99th and Indian School just to eat at this restaurant (it used to be called Lone Star, but they had to change the name because the crappy restaurant chain of that name legally forced them to change names when the chain moved into town.) 

I'd still drive 40 miles to go to Texaz Grill.  The fillet is wonderful (sometimes I get it without the butter).  They have the best mashed potatoes in the state, swimming in a HUGE amount of gravy (good stuff, but I typically spoon off a bit).  The salad is fantastic (chopped green olives on top...who'd a thought they'd taste so good on a salad with ranch?!)

Service is good.  They don't mess around here...good food, good atmosphere, decent pricing for what you get.

This place was horrible. We are a large Hispanic family and the way we were treated, it felt as though we were in the 1960s and the civil rights movement had just ended. The waitress who took our order was rude, every little thing we asked for seemed like the biggest problem.

But the real issue was when the second waitress came and asked my husband to scoot in closer to the table because the lady behind him couldn't sit comfortable enough - mind you, said lady stopped her and told her she was fine - but the waitress insisted that he need to move to an uncomfortable position so that the other person would be better (HE WAS ALREADY SITTING WITH HIS BODY TOCHING THE TABLE)! Absolutely rude, uncalled for, and unnecessary - as clients our needs were, clearly, of less importance - which left us wondering why? From the moment we walked in, we received nothing but attitude, especially in comparison to everyone else enjoying their meals.

The food wasn't good and even if it had any goodness in it, we didn't taste it because we were beyond upset. It was incredible that there is such an atmosphere that still exist this way - we were in shock. 

The most aggravating part? We were only in Phoenix for the day - we live in TEXAS! This restaurant is the most abominable example of Texas food and hospitality, if you really want something from the Texas menu then please come and eat here, in Texas - we really are a friendly state! This restaurant, in the very least, should change their name because it was nowhere close to the Texas environment - I found it an embarrassment as a born & raised TEXAN!

Walking in, the decor was just ok.  We had the chicken fried steak, kids prime rib, and rib eye.  The prime rib was smoked and they didn't say that on the kids menu and it had an odd taste to it.  I liked the ice cream cup at the end of my meal.

Editing to three stars.  GREAT customer service.

The filet here is awesome at only $22 (with fries, a salad, and biscuits and bread). Additionally, there is great Texas stuff all over the walls, with a definite focus on the Big Bend (Marfa, Terlingua, etc.) and Gulf Coast regions. Good weeknight specials, but I have not tried weekend brunch yet. I've been here about 3 times.

This has been on my AZ bucket list for years and decided to drop by tonight for dinner with the family. From chatting it up with some of the regulars, to the "Texas Trivia" with the owner at our table. The food and the vibe here were absolutely wonderful. Will definitely be back again and again!

The so called famous chicken fried steak was too bland and mostly batter. They also ran out of BBQ ribs on a Saturday night which is apparently due to lack of planning I suppose. Price is too expensive for the quality of food.

Place has Texas ambiance in spades.  You leave the cavernous restaurant and you almost expect to step onto a dusty street in the panhandle.  The chicken fried steak is great and when you consider the $8 price tag it becomes downright splendid.

This is the ONLY place to get Chicken Fried Steak! The portions are HUGE so bring your appetite. The pulled pork is good too! Just took some visiting friends this last week and it was delicious as always. They loved it. These guys are very consistent and the service is excellent! The have a cool little bar too. Not really for families... this is for the grown-ups!

Came here with family for dinner. Had smoke prime rib!! It was amazing I can't wait to go back !!! Everyone in the family had something different so we all tried a bite or two of different plates   Yum !!!!

Id definitely recommend this texas style hole in the wall joint.  It reminds me of my days I texas.  Funny bumper stickers and hats as decor. Expire fed friendly waitstaff that know how to get you feeling comfortable or put you I your place.  
I went with a cold bud light as the domestic choices just spoke to me! The chopped brisket sandwich was really quiet good despite being served upside down.  Maybe that's the thing.  I ordered a frito pie and and it came on bag ready to go.  What a good ole Sunday place.
They brought be a fun little fried rice cake beignet thing with a good amount of powdered sugar and life was good. 
If this place wasn't in a strip center I think you'd believe you were in a shack on a ranch grubbing down.
Enjoy!

We heard great things from a coworker about this place.  We took the opportunity of being in Phoenix proper to swing by for dinner.  Service was friendly and reasonably efficient.  We ordered the chicken-fried steak and smoked prime rib.  We got the LAST piece of prime rib (it's limited every day, apparently).

The smoked prime rib was a bit fatty, but the flavor was very good.  The chicken-fried steak seemed to be a lot more breading than steak.  Believe it or not Denny's has a better breading/steak ratio.  The breading itself didn't seem to have any flavor or seasoning to it.  Usually I go very light on the cream sauce when I order a chicken-fried steak, but here you need to go heavier to give it more flavor.  Now to be fair it was really good when I did that, but I think that was much more the sauce than the steak.  Which just seems wrong to me.  The sauce should enhance the flavor, not embody all the flavor.  That's why I can't bring myself to go to four stars.  I could have put the sauce on a piece of bread and probably gotten about the same flavor experience.

Portions were pretty generous, and the sides were basic but good.

We went here for lunch today, the food was pretty bad. I ordered the big Texas sandwich or whatever it's called and it was almost inedible. It had the cheap Kraft cheese barley melted on it and weird coleslaw...? Anyways, I originally tried to order chicken tenders and fries and was told by the waitress I wasn't allowed because I wasn't a child. I had a child at the table sitting right next to me?! She said the cooks wouldn't make it for me because it wasn't actually for the child it was for me.... ummm.. okay? So I end up with this crappy sand which instead.  The waitress was a little rude.
